text: A one-pot protocol of double Suzuki–Miyaura reactions has been developed for the synthesis of unsymme-trical terphenyls. In the absence of a ligand, potassium bromophenyltrifluoroborate reacts with arylboronic acid and then sequentially with a hetero/aryl bromide by controlling the reaction temperature, providing unsymmetrical p-and m-terphenyl compounds in moderate to good overall yields.

reactions.Reactant: potassium bromophenyltrifluoroborate, arylboronic acid, hetero/aryl bromide
reactions.Yield: moderate to good overall yields (unsymmetrical p-and m-terphenyl compounds)

text: It was interesting to observe a notable chemo-selectivity, and 1a was transformed into thecorresponding cross-coupled product 1c with an 89% yield, while 1b provided only a 10% yield of product 1d. The high selectivity under this multi-organoboron system revealed that 4-bromobenzaldehyde cross-couples with 1a very fast and most of the base is consumed, which might suppress the hydrolysis of potassium organotrifluoroborates.41
An 80% yield of the terphenyl product 2e was achieved at the reaction temperature of 80 °C. We next explored the scope and limitations of this one-pot cross-coupling protocol.

In summary, we have developed a convenient one-pot double Suzuki–Miyaura reaction protocol for the synthesis of unsym-metrical terphenyls. Potassium bromophenyltrifluoroborates underwent chemo-selective cross-coupling with coupling part-ners by controlling the reaction temperature in the absence of any ligand.

reactions.Temperature: in the absence of any ligand
